version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Hand symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A¬†thumbs-down gesture indicating disapproval. Thumbs Down was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name ‚ÄúThumbs Down Sign‚Äù and  http://emojipedia.org/thumbs-down-sign/
emoji_net_data.name: thumbs down

bn:00107198a: Characterized by or displaying negation or denial or opposition or resistance; having no positive features

bn:00101571a: Afflicted with or marked by anxious uneasiness or trouble or grief.
Afflicted with or marked by anxious uneasiness or trouble or grief

bn:00101752a: Being or moving lower in position or less in some value

bn:00107314a: Quantifier; used with either mass nouns or plural count nouns for indicating a complete or almost complete lack or zero quantity of

bn:00086884v: To condemn; consider wrong or inappropriate.

bn:00086983v: To have or feel a dislike or distaste for.
Have or feel a dislike or distaste for

bn:00013859n: An experience that is irritating or frustrating or disappointing

bn:00027620n: A sudden violent feeling of disgust.
Disgust is an emotional response of revulsion to something considered offensive or unpleasant.
A feeling of aversion or antipathy
An attitude or a feeling of distaste or aversion.
Extreme hatred or detestation; the feeling of utter dislike.
A feeling of aversion or antipathy.
The feeling of extreme disgust and hatred; abhorrence; detestation; loathing.

bn:03168943n: A thumbs-up or thumbs-down is a common hand gesture achieved by a closed fist held with the thumb extended upward or downward in approval or disapproval, respectively.
A gesture signifying approval or okay; a thumb pointing up out of a fist.

bn:00042759n: That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
The part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
The zoological term for the distal portion of the forelimb of an animal (including the human hand)
The (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
The manus is the zoological term for the distal portion of the fore limb of an animal.
A hand, as the part of the fore limb below the forearm in a man, or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.
A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered extremity located at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.

bn:00063376n: The short thick digit of the hand that for humans has the most mobility and can be made to oppose (moved to touch) all of the other fingers.
The thumb is the last digit of the hand.
The thick short innermost digit of the forelimb
The shortest and thickest of the fingers that can be placed against the others in order to create a firm grip.
